issue.title: [CF 939] Tracking Enemy Totems
issue.body:
To whom it may concern.

I hope this is the correct place to ask this information. But what I am after I cannot find anywhere on the net or an example of it.

What I want to be able to do, is track a certain enemy totem. In my case, I want Tell Me When to pop up the icon for when an enemy shaman (target or focus) has a grounding totem down. I am unable to work out how to use Tell Me When to do this for me. I have Tell Me When tracking everything else I need, but I just can't get it to track an enemy totem.

I have asked on the WOW Forums, and someone did try and help, but it doesn't seem to work for me either, and I don't understand the coding of it. For that Forum Thread, check out this site :-

http://us.battle.net/wow/en/forum/topic/12186588665

Would someone be able to provide instructions / coding on how I could get Tell Me When to track an enemy totem (well in my case just Grounding Totem)?

Any help / assistance would be greatly appreciated.

Apologies in advance if this is not the correct forum to ask this question.


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15 | Imported from CurseForge issue #939 | Raw

> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15

That code looks to me like it should work. What problems were you having with it? Were you not able to import it? Or were you able to import it but it did not work for you?

To import it, paste the string at the bottom of the Icon Editor and then click the glowing green button to the right to import it. After importing both the code snippet and the icon, reload your UI so that the snippet will be ran.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you Cybeloras. I'll give it another go tonight. I'm not sure if I imported correctly, but when I tried to import it and clicked run, it came up with some errors. But I didn't import the icon when I tried to run it.

I will try to import it again, this time as per instructions you have mentioned. It will be great if it works.

I'll let you know in a day or so if I can get it working. Thanks for replying.


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15

Hi Cybeloras. I tried importing that code and seemed to have some success in that it appeared to recognise that it was a grounding totem I was trying to track, but when the time came to track a grounding totem, it didn't appear to work. I took some screen shots of what I imported and how it is set up, but the 3rd attachment you will notice when tested, I couldn't get it to work. It should be showing in the bottom - centre near where it's tracking the druid buff, but it doesn't. What you see in the top left corner is "Lose Control" which seems to detect grounding totem.

Is there something I have not done correctly? Maybe the icon I didn't correctly import? I couldn't find at first where to import the icon, but then I found somewhere to import it as an icon. If you could assist in getting this Grounding Totem tracking working, that would be greatly appreciated. I also apologise in advance if I have missed something simple. I can make "Tell Me When" do whatever I need it to do if it's a simple buff I'm tracking, but this LUA code seems very hard for me to work out and understand for some reason.

Your assistance / help would be much appreciated.


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15

In your screenshot, you appear to be testing with friendly players, but the code is specifically written to only track totems cast by enemies. Also make sure that you reloaded your UI after importing everything.

Edited Apr 14, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Also, I just noticed something wrong with the code. Take this line:

``` tracker:SetScript("OnEvent", TMW.CNDT.Env.GroundingTotemOnEvent) ```

and move it to the very end of the code. Make sure to click the "accept" button after editing the code so that your changes are saved.

Edited Apr 14, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I made the changes as you noted in your response. But because of the shut down, I never got to test it. I will try some arena tonight to see if it works.

With that one line that had to be shifted, I moved it to the very bottom of the code. The last few lines are like 'End' 'End' 'End'. I moved it to the bottom below all the 'Ends'. Then I clicked accept. Hope that's what you meant.

I am hoping to get some shammy's tonight in arena so I can test this out.

Thanks for your help to date. I'll let you know once I have tested it vs enemy Grounding Totems.


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15

Cyberloras. I have the code all in as noted. Tried to test it out last night but couldn't find an enemy shammy that dropped a Grounding Totem. I will do my best to see if it works over the coming days and will let you know how it goes. Cheers for your help to date :)


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15

Cyberloras - I have been usuing this to track enemey totems, and it does work, but it's not Target or Focus specific. It's good for arena, as it will track either a Target or Focus grounding totem. But in a bg, it still detects grounding totems, but it's not dependant on Target or Focus. It seems to detect any enemy grounding totem in the vicinity whether I'm targeting the shammy or not.

Is there anyway to make it specifically detect only Target or Focus enemy grounding totems? I'm sorry it's taken a while to respond. I haven't been usuing my hunter as much and haven't as many opportunities to detect grounding totem as I would have liked.

If there is a way to track only Target or Focus enemy grounding totems that would be great.

So just to re-cap - this does track enemy grounding totems, but it doesn't appear to be specific for Target and Focus totems. If it could be fine tuned for Target or Focus that would be great.

Thanks for your help to date.


> Posted by CurseForge user arcticwolf15
